title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.17.4-5 | 15-02-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare / Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: Pariksit is a qualified Kshatriya. He has got the courage to face such upstarts. He is well equipped to deal sufficient punishment to the miscreants and he has got his authority to enforce law and order.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verses from Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on Maharaj Pariksit's role as a qualified Kshatriya challenging the influence of Kali.

segments.key_quote: Unfortunately we don't have qualified Kshatriyas like Pariksit Maharaj in our present time.
segments.summary: The speaker laments the absence of qualified Kshatriyas in the present age and criticizes the ineffectiveness of modern leaders elected through degraded public votes.

segments.key_quote: It is one's actions which are counted. It is very important. The actions are important.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of actions over mere appearance, explaining Pariksit Maharaj's questioning of Kali Purusha and introducing the concept of 'twice-born' for Brahmanas, Kshatriyas, and Vaishyas.

segments.key_quote: Second birth is a cultural rejuvenation, reviving the spiritual culture. And how does it happen? It happens by spiritual initiation obtained from the bona fide Acharya, by spiritual initiation.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the concept of second birth through spiritual initiation and discusses the Kshatriya's duty to protect the helpless, connecting it to the incarnation of the Lord to re-establish religious principles.

segments.key_quote: In the age of Kali, the poor helpless animals, especially the cows, which are meant to receive all sorts of protection from the administrative age, are killed without restriction.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the Lord's incarnations to protect the saintly and destroy miscreants, highlighting the lack of cow protection in Kali Yuga and criticizing administrators who are representatives of God in name only.

segments.key_quote: Therefore in the age of Kali everyone is unhappy due to the maladministration of the state.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing the worthlessness of unqualified leaders, the resulting maladministration, and the general unhappiness in Kali Yuga due to the lack of proper, trained Kshatriya rulers.
